content:
you say 'only a small percentage of bats carry the virus'. well, yes, there are a lot of species of bat. but you said before that 50% of flying foxes have been estimated to carry it.

how do you pronounce lyssavirus. can you spell it in phonetic letters for me?

on another note, what other nerveviruses affect humans? what about nerve viruses in other animals that researchers were may make a zoonotic leap to people. there is that deer virus in north america that gets in prions. hunters and such are urged not to eat the brains of many animals because of this. what other diseases can humans get from eating brains?
